display_asset.caption: Julio Pino, an associate professor of history at Kent State University, is under investigation.
display_asset.credit: Kent State University

summaries.body: The F.B.I. is investigating Julio Pino, an associate professor in the history department of Kent State University in Ohio, over possible involvement with the Islamic State.

display_asset.credit: Elliot Davis

summaries.body: The Sundance Film Festival opens Thursday. It includes "The Birth of a Nation," which tells the true story of Nat Turner, a literate slave who organizes a rebellion.

display_asset.caption: Jimmy Savile after being appointed an officer of the Most Excellent Order of the British Empire at Buckingham Palace in London, in 1972.
display_asset.credit: Les Lee/Hulton Archive, via Getty Images

summaries.body: The BBC's culture of deference allowed Jimmy Savile, the disgraced British TV personality, to sexually assault children for decades, according to a leaked draft of an inquiry.

display_asset.caption: Cupcake, left, and Yung, both pit bull mixes, during “puppy playgroup” in the backyard at the East Harlem shelter run by Animal Care Centers of NYC. The program was added in 2014 to improve the dogs’ immunity and make them more docile and adoptable, the shelter said.
display_asset.credit: Nicole Bengiveno/The New York Times

summaries.body: Euthanasia rates are falling for dogs and cats while adoptions are on the rise amid reforms at New York City's three animal shelters.

display_asset.caption: Malvina Hunt, 100, at home in central New York on Wednesday. She said vigorous exercise was the secret to her longevity.
display_asset.credit: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times

summaries.body: Move over, millennials: The number of Americans age 100 and older is up by 44 percent since 2000, federal health officials reported Thursday.

display_asset.credit: Tsafrir Abayov/Associated Press

summaries.body: Airbnb is being criticized for listing rental properties in the West Bank. Palestinians say the website is aiding Israeli settlement claims.

display_asset.caption: A scene from the drama “As You Are,” which is screening at the Sundance Film Festival.
display_asset.credit: Sundance Film Festival

summaries.body: The Sundance Film Festival is joining the national discussion about mass shootings and gun control, with at least four gun-themed films premiering there this year.

display_asset.caption: Mr. Cosby at his arraignment.
display_asset.credit: Montgomery County Office of the District Attorney, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Pennsylvania prosecutor hit back at attempts by Bill Cosby’s legal team to have the criminal charges against Mr. Cosby dismissed.

display_asset.caption: Cauliflowers for sale at a grocery store in Ottawa, Canada.
display_asset.credit: Dave Chan for The New York Times

summaries.body: In Canada, the eight-dollar cauliflower shows how the value of the Canadian dollar has fallen, with the country's economy dependent on oil and other resources.

display_asset.caption: Track Palin in 2008.
display_asset.credit: Emmanuel Dunand/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Track Palin, a son of Sarah Palin, was arrested and charged in a domestic violence case in which his girlfriend said he punched her and threatened to fire a rifle.

display_asset.caption: Adele is among those scheduled to perform at the Grammy Awards on Feb. 15.
display_asset.credit: Virginia Sherwood/NBC

summaries.body: Adele, whose album "25" was released too late for consideration this year, will perform at the Grammy Awards on Feb. 15. Kendrick Lamar and the Weeknd are also among the scheduled acts.

display_asset.credit: Austin Anthony/Daily News, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Meteorologists are expecting one to two feet of snow on the East Coast this weekend; Washington is squarely in the storm's path, but New York may avoid the brunt of it.

display_asset.caption: St. Elijah’s Monastery near Mosul, Iraq, in 2009. Satellite photos confirm the site was destroyed by Islamic State militants in 2014.
display_asset.credit: Eros Hoagland for The New York Times

summaries.body: Satellite images show that St. Elijah’s Monastery, a 1,400-year-old stone sanctuary overlooking Mosul, Iraq, was razed to rubble by ISIS militants, probably in late 2014.

display_asset.caption: Grace Coddington at a New York Fashion Week event in 2014.
display_asset.credit: Isak Tiner for The New York Times

summaries.body: After more than a quarter century as the creative director for Vogue, Grace Coddington is dialing down her role, in yet another major shift in the fashion industry.

display_asset.caption: The oil rig Haiyang Shiyou 981 in the South China Sea in 2012.
display_asset.credit: Jin Liangkuai/Xinhua, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Vietnam has lashed out against the presence of a Chinese oil rig in the disputed waters of the South China Sea, the latest in what Vietnam says are a series of provocative actions by Beijing.
An elementary school tutor in Tennessee was arrested after the authorities found nine young children in her car.

display_asset.caption: A horse-drawn carriage waits for a fare on Central Park South Avenue this month. A plan by Mayor Bill de Blasio to reduce the number of carriages and restrict them to Central Park has attracted a diverse group of opponents.
display_asset.credit: Bryan Thomas for The New York Times

summaries.body: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s plan to shrink the horse-carriage trade in Manhattan is facing a diverse bloc of opponents, including parks activists and animal-rights groups.

display_asset.credit: Frank Augstein/Associated Press

summaries.body: Stephen Hawking says he believes the key to saving humanity will be colonizing other planets. But the renowned physicist, whose recent lecture will be broadcast next week, does not think that will happen soon.

display_asset.caption: Candy Henderson rested on a brisk Tuesday in her tent, not far from the Malheur National Wildlife Refuge in Oregon.
display_asset.credit: Jarod Opperman for The New York Times

summaries.body: There's a new twist to the standoff between armed antigovernment protesters and law enforcement agents in Oregon: counterprotesters.
Justin Trudeau and Joseph R. Biden Jr. are among the biggest draws at the World Economic Forum in Davos, along with Leonardo DiCaprio, who received an award.
Twins and their grandparents were killed in a fire in Maryland. The house, in Chillum, Prince George’s County, appeared to have had no smoke detectors, officials said.

display_asset.caption: Rich Walter ran in frigid temperatures on Monday in Minneapolis, Minn.
display_asset.credit: Elizabeth Flores/Star Tribune, via Associated Press

summaries.body: The season’s first major snowfall could hit the East Coast this weekend. One expert said there could be up to two feet of snow from Washington to New York and Boston.

display_asset.caption: United States Marines searched for debris from two CH-53E helicopters along the coast of Haleiwa, Hawaii, on Saturday.
display_asset.credit: Aaron S. Patterson/United States Marine Corps, via European Pressphoto Agency

summaries.body: Five days after two helicopters are thought to have collided off the coast of Hawaii, the search continues for the 12 Marines on board. The Marine Corps released names.

display_asset.caption: David Oyelowo at a Golden Globes party in Beverly Hills, Calif., this month.
display_asset.credit: Richard Shotwell/Invision, via Richard Shotwell, via Invision, via Associated Press

summaries.body: David Oyelowo, who played Martin Luther King Jr. in “Selma,” told a gala that the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences “doesn’t reflect this nation.”

display_asset.caption: Caitlyn Jenner will write a memoir with the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Buzz Bissinger.
display_asset.credit: Amy Lombard for The New York Times

summaries.body: Caitlyn Jenner is planning to release a memoir in the spring of 2017 about her transformation. She will write it with the Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Buzz Bissinger.

display_asset.credit: Jennifer S. Altman for The New York Times

summaries.body: The Spanish-language media giant Univision announced Tuesday that it has acquired a controlling stake in The Onion, the satirical site.

display_asset.caption: Twitter did not say how many of its users were being affected by the disruptions or what had caused them.
display_asset.credit: Emmanuel Dunand/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: Twitter experienced widespread shutdowns on Tuesday, preventing many of its more than 300 million users from sharing updates on their smartphones or computers.

display_asset.credit: Benjamin Lowy for The New York Times

summaries.body: Can vegetarians eat jellyfish? A neuroscientist uses the question as a starting point to discuss how technology may soon blur the divide between vegetarians and omnivores.

display_asset.caption: Tasmina Ahmed-Sheikh of the Scottish National Party speaks during the debate over petitions on whether to bar Donald J. Trump from visiting Britain.
display_asset.credit: UK Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

summaries.body: British lawmakers condemned Donald J. Trump during a three-hour debate in Parliament, but shied away from the idea of barring him from entering the country.
As the price of oil has declined, one investor in Texas is betting that the price of land will, too. So he is raising a $100 million private equity fund to buy Texas ranches.
